intro: Baliospermum reidioides, commonly known as the African sunflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Baliospermum reidioides is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
